so it was definitely a really interesting challenge because we we were trying to do something very different

days before the cloud there would be very infrequent very very large launches you you'd eagerly await the newest
operating system or the newest uh release of office something like that and those were few and far between
they'd be much rumored and anticipated and every couple years there'd be a big burst of activity of a launch and
somehow I get the sense that we were going to do things very differently with AWS and it was going to be something
very regular and very frequent and so that we need to have this ongoing Communication channel so what what we do
at Amazon when we're trying to propose something new we write a document uh typically called a narrative document
and you basically say here here's the problem I'd like to solve and here's how I propose to solve it now thinking back
I think we were a little bit less formal about this back then but I remember writing this document and sharing it with Andy jassy um sharing it with Drew
herderner who was running our PR and it was still part of PR and they certainly
understood the the best idea but because it was a gonna be a fairly direct
communication Channel and we were very controlled in our in our PR back in

kind of clear that a Blog had to be a little bit different so the the biggest challenge was to
to figure out how could we do that efficiently and not have to get multiple people in the loop for review and at a

a leadership principle called um diving deep and so with diving deep when the
when something branded does come along the the challenge is to say well this is

had to write about Quantum Computing so I I didn't do especially well in math or science in high school or in college I

that everybody's mind works differently but after I do one of these deep Dives the
the the essence remains with me only for a little bit of time and then we move on

Innovation stream so you know one of the one of my

I and I fully grasp but that's a really difficult thing to do now with that said
at the point when we as bloggers get to see the first iteration of the new

we get to take a look and it's quite often the case that we are the first
people to really get to see this and to to put it through its paces and what will happen is sometimes the

they kind of think okay it's it's really great and you do this and this and this and all these amazing things happen and

team thinks they are but sometimes it's maybe not as easy as they thought it
should be or the flow isn't quite right and what we have to do is we we have to
very delicately balance the fact that we know this team is very eager to ship and
get this product out to customers versus understanding that the customers really have have a certain level of

find things that we are not fully in agreement with let's say we have to
communicate these back to the team all the way while realized that this team has been working really hard for a long

never do multi-part posts and we try to keep our posts somewhere between generally like 700 to 900 words we're
